snippet: The Federal Communications Commission can require cellphone companies to let customers of other carriers use their signals when outside their home territories.
abstract: United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia upholds Federal Communications Commission rule that requires cellphone companies to allow customers of competing wireless carriers to use their networks for Internet and e-mail when outside their home territory; Verizon Wireless had challenged agency's data roaming order.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission can require cellphone companies to let customers of other carriers use their signals when outside their home territories.

headline.main: Court Upholds F.C.C. Rule on Use of Data Networks
headline.print_headline: Court Upholds F.C.C. Rule On Use of Data Networks
